Experience: ['DescriptionJob Description:Silver Peak is currently at the forefront one of the most exciting and disruptive trends in the history of the networking industry - the software-defined wide area network, or SD-WAN. Enterprises and service providers alike are aggressively turning to Silver Peak to help provide cutting-edge SD-WAN solutions to more effectively and efficiently connect their users to applications. Silver Peak is growing rapidly and building out our sales and marketing organizations to help drive our significant growth. We are currently seeking experienced and professional sales engineers to capitalize on our momentum, to drive direct enterprise sales, and to expand our market penetration around our products in this rapidly growing market.The OpportunityWe are looking for a Pre-Sales Systems Engineer (SE) to overcome and remove all technical barriers in the sales process. You will work with a regional account manager to develop new business working directly with customers and partners. The SE role will require you to act as a trusted technical advisor who can effectively position the Silver Peak Software Defined WAN (SD-WAN) and WAN optimization solutions.You will be located in Chicago. Travel will be around 50% and will be mostly in the Chicago area.You will report to the SE Manager, Central.What You Will Do45 Percent Sell to and persuade technical personnel at medium and large enterprises on the value of Silver Peak Deliver pre-sales presentations and demonstrations to customers and partners Support sales efforts through on-site meetings, group presentations and marketing activities Manage and own all technical aspects of the sales cycle45 Percent Architect, install and configure the Silver Peak virtual and hardware appliances into customer environments for proof-of-concept and production deployments Own the technical relationship with customers, partners and resellers through technical training, problem escalation and new feature requests Maintain a strong market awareness and knowledge of competitive technologies to best position Silver Peak10 Percent Provide prompt feedback to and be ready to aid product management and engineering on future direction of the product Travel to trade shows, marketing events and Silver Peak headquarters Participate in discussion with marketing and engineering teams on new product introduction and provide feedbackWhat You Excel AtNetworking Ability to demonstrate a knowledge of networking protocols (TCP/IP, UDP) Working experience with VLANs and IP subnetting Experience using routing protocols such as OSPF and BGP Knowledge and experience creating access control lists (ACLs) on routers and switches Recent experience using the CLI on major router and switch vendors Ability to present to an audience of mixed roles and technical abilities within an organization Troubleshooting skills that include hands-on experience with the configuration of networking gearServers and Storage Working knowledge of the installation and configuration of virtual machines on major hypervisors (VMware, Hyper-V) Competent troubleshooting skills on the installation and configuration of hypervisors and operating systemsSoftware Skills Microsoft Visio Microsoft Office Suite (Power Point, Excel, Word) Microsoft Windows, Apple OS X, Linux operating system experiencePersonal Skills Team player willing to help out peers and other teams within the company Ability to present to a large audience or group of people Internal drive and positive attitude to go above and beyond whenever necessary to compete and win business Ability to occasionally work nights and weekends around customer schedulesYour Education, Experience, And Certification BSCS or equivalent degree 7+ years of experience as a pre-sales Systems/Sales Engineer Technical certifications are a plus (VCP, CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, JNCP)']

['Role The Supply Planning Manager is responsible for ensuring that the supply, distribution, production, capacity and inventory plans are established in conjunction with demand plans and manufacturing processes to meet business needs. The role will ensure that product is available at the right time and right location ready to ship to satisfy customer demand. The role involves establishing an inventory strategy to deliver customer service goals and ensuring that capacity plans are developed to support the demand plan. The role is one of the key links between the manufacturing facilities, demand planning and the business teams including Marketing, Sales, Finance, Logistics and Customer Service. \xa0Reporting to the Demand Planning Manager, this role will be located in our corporate office in Fulton Market but on occasion travel to our warehouse and production facility in Franklin Park.  What you will be responsible for Executing an effective, timely Supply Planning process that includes supply model design, distribution and production planning, capacity planning, inventory planning to cover a rolling 12-24 months horizon. Accountable for performance to plan, plan stability, customer service and inventory levels. Executing effective, timely phase-in and phase-out plans for new products, product changes, to support innovation and product change management processes by interacting with Demand Planning, Marketing and Sales. Setting strategic direction for inventory management in line with business growth strategies. Monitoring, tracking and reporting on the delivery of the supply and inventory plans following release for execution on a weekly basis. Working jointly with supply chain teams and internal/external manufacturing sites to identify options when supply is strained or constrained. Managing internal and external manufacturing capacity & communicate risk & opportunities within the S&OP process. Developing and maintaining very strong relationships with commercial team and commercial team leadership through excellent listening and communication skills to ensure an effective sales forecasting process. Driving a culture of exception management by proactively identifying major issues and opportunities around demand and supply. Driving culture of analysis and execution taking ownership of identified issues in supply planning to drive quantifiable solutions and positive business results.  Who you are You have a bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Operations Research, Math/Statistics, Supply Chain, or Operations Management (required). You have minimum 7+ years of experience supply, production and capacity planning in CPG industry (required). You have demonstrated experience with supply planning tools such as DemandWorks, Logility, SAP APS, Oracle APO, JDA, Manugistics (required). You have experience in a leadership role, able to coach and mentor. You have managed and facilitated supply planning, S&OP or Supply Review Meetings. You have exceptional computer skills; ERP, Business Intelligence systems or equivalent and Word, Excel, PowerPoint. You have excellent communication skills to effectively communicate across multiple departments and through multiple levels of the organization. You have demonstrated influencing, negotiating and conflict management skills. You have excellent collaborative management skills. You have strong working knowledge of effective supply chain performance including supply planning, customer service, supplier and asset management. You have strong passion for creating process and systems improvement. You have CPIM or CSCP certifications from APICS. You have the ability to ready, write and understand English.']

Comfortable working independently as well as in a team environment.Up to 30% travel to trade shows, industry conferences, partner/customer locations\ufeffHow do I apply?Please email your resume to jobs@cicplus.com with the following information:Compensation expectationsAvailable start dateHow you heard about usCover letter (Preferred but not required, we’d love to get to know you outside of the resume.)']

A workplace recognized as the Startup of the Yearzaeeuqaxrwuybbuwdavye by Built in Chicago, a Top Workplace by Chicago Tribune, and one of Chicago’s Best Places to Work for Women Under 35 by Crain’s Chicago Business.Classification Of Protected Categories Is As FollowsIf you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA.A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran\'s discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.Form CC-305OMB Control Number 1250-0005Expires 1/31/2020Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities1. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.Disabilities Include, But Are Not Limited To Blindness  Deafness  Cancer  Diabetes  Epilepsy  Autism  Cerebral palsy  HIV/AIDS  Schizophrenia  Muscular dystrophy  Bipolar disorder  Major depression  Multiple sclerosis (MS)  Missing limbs or partially missing limbs  Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)  Obsessive compulsive disorder  Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair  Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.']

['ositive Partnerships is at the heart of Artis s philosophy. The Director of Marketing works collaboratively with Artis Corporate partners, the marketing team, the Executive Director and other leaders within Artis. The Director of Marketing is responsible for generating leads, and translating them into sales. This position also develops and executes a creative and aggressive marketing strategy. This includes responsibility for electronic and print advertising as well as generating a social media presence that portrays the Artis Way. The successful candidate will possess the ability to calibrate strategy as needed to achieve results. Planning and hosting events to showcase our Community to prospective residents is also an aspect of this position. This position also provides day to day leadership for two marketing team members. EOE SDL2017']

['This position is responsible for identifying, developing and executing sourcing events for the most cost effective pricing and best service; developing strategic sourcing plan by partnering with users to define specifications and requirements; managing the strategic sourcing strategy for a specific group; analyzing industry markets, trends and assessing risk, gathering intelligence on fundamental conditions, and technical information. SUMMARY: Critical member of a high performing team, responsible for executing on strategic supplier initiatives for multiple categories including Information Technology, Corporate Services – HR, Payroll, Marketing, Communication. Responsible for fostering business critical relationships with suppliers and business stakeholders that are key to the organization. This position is accountable for managing all aspects of strategic sourcing including following procurement best practices, guiding internal resources, facilitating requirements, contract drafting and negotiations, gathering and conducting data analysis and research, training and mentoring junior team members, and implementing the identified opportunities directly alongside senior management. Required Job Qualifications: College Degree in Business or Finance, or 6 - 8 years of relevant experience Expert knowledge of strategic sourcing principles Effective team leadership; strategic thinker who is energized by change and impact. Outstanding interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Analytical skills and business acumen to determine how to best leverage deal points. * Conflict resolution skills. Consistent thought leadership Understanding of current market trends and pricing models Extensive experience in project management, market analysis, category management and contract negotiation. Extensive experience developing presentations and presenting to management and other internal groups. Self-sufficient on all projects, with minimal to no leadership direction Ability to lead projects without much leadership guidance Lead and drive to desired customer outcomes Problem solver who can drive change Viewed as expert in field, either process or domain expertise PC proficiency to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint Preferred Job Qualifications: 4 - 8 years of experience in strategic sourcing and contract negotiation Consulting experience and/or currently working for Consulting Organization specializing procurement/strategic sourcing Knowledge of IT, HR, Payroll etc']

["Job Description General Description Medulla is a high-growth healthcare organization looking for an Internal Marketing Coordinator to drive new patient acquisition in existing Midwestern clinic locations as well as new and acquired locations across the U.S. as we expand. Medulla s Internal Marketing Coordinator must have a solid understanding of how to increase new patient acquisition via cross channel marketing approach and is a crucial component in the company s overall marketing strategy. The IMC reports directly to the Manager of Internal Marketing to support the successful creation, development, training, implementation and execution of internal marketing initiatives across multiple brands in the chiropractic healthcare space. These initiatives include a combination of traditional in-clinic promotional events (workshops, dinner with the doc and patient appreciation days) as well as edgy digital patient centered social and email marketing campaigns. The role is highly metrics driven and is accountable for specific acquisition goals per clinic location and across all brands on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.Essential Functions And Responsibilities Implement high performance internal marketing initiatives to hit and exceed a patient acquisition target across all offices in a multi brand space. Collaborate with creative, digital and clinical operations. Analyze and report results.  Work with the Manager of Internal Marketing to develop health-focused infographics, tip sheets, how-to videos and patient testimonial videos to be utilized in print and digitally (social, email, in-office televisions).  Produce monthly in-clinic workshops (30-60 minutes) to increase current patient education and attract guests as new patients.  Organize promotional print materials, scripts and food orders for monthly internal dinner with the doc program and other internal marketing events.  Create and coordinate monthly health focused patient appreciation days for in-office implementation with themed giveaways for referral incentives.  Create and implement social and email campaigns for varying platforms (Facebook, Instagram, email, etc) among current patient base to drive referrals, retention and reactivation.  Train, support, and develop marketing skills (conversation starters, impactful questions, asking for the referrals and closing) and scripts with all clinical staff members (DCs, CMs and CTs) on a bi-monthly basis. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree  Experience running innovative multi-channel marketing campaigns including presentation, print, event, social and email marketing with proven results  Planning and analytical skills are essential to success  Proficient in (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.) Exceptional presentation skills including the ability to present to large groups of professionals both in person and virtually  Ability to engage large teams through strategy and incentives  Ability to perform in clinic visits 1-2 times per week  Minimal potential for out of town travel (<5%) Must have access to a reliable vehicle, valid driver s license and good driving record Preferred Qualifications Healthcare marketing experience  Experience with creating, executing and coordinating marketing initiatives (workshops, dinner with the doc, patient appreciation days and trainings) across a multi-location organization  Experience hosting virtual meetings and trainings  Job Competencies  Achievement oriented; motivated by achieving metrics, goals and company objectives  Influence a group of diverse team members including new hires and established employees to leverage their strengths using creative problem solving skills to increase Internal Referrals  Ability to work effectively and collaborate across creative, content, digital and clinical operations teams.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  .  Passion for improving the patient journey through innovative and creative internal campaigns SDL2017"]

Company Name: WorkinEntertainment.com - Jobs in TV, Film, Radio, Music and Media
Experience: ['The Marketing Manager is accountable for driving incremental ticket sales through the creation and implementation of strategic marketing plans for his or her assigned accounts, with a heavy focus on digital media. The Manager delivers the full range of our assets and services, and reinforces Ticketmaster’s Marketing value proposition by:  Deploying our marketing talent, assets and services to help clients sell more tickets;  Collecting data, performing analyses and creating recommendations that separate Ticketmaster from the competition;  Serving as a conduit for sharing best-practices, trends, and synthesizing the experiences of other clients to provide highly valuable idea-starters and improve marketing results; and  Providing related specialty services as we develop them. The Manager is responsive, flexible, results-driven, dynamic, highly collaborative and an excellent communicator. He or she successfully balances strategic and operational roles in an ever-changing environment. Our world is characterized by clients with highly variable needs and periods of intense activity. Understanding these client needs, designing marketing plans customized around them, and communicating effectively are central to the Manager’s success. What the job is:  Maintain knowledge of current industry events and trends, and integrate that knowledge and the implications into marketing strategies.  Leverage a deep understanding of the client’s goals and priorities to develop strategic marketing plans for assigned accounts, with a heavy focus on digital.  Liaise with internal teams to coordinate the successful execution of multi-channel media campaigns.  Evaluate, approve, and execute email marketing campaigns on behalf of the client.  Track all marketing activities at the client, market, regional and national level.  Communicate effectively and frequently with both clients and internal account management people. Client communication needs to be highly professional and persuasive.  Monitor and review campaign performance to help draw conclusions about what approaches deliver the best results.  Secure, test and troubleshoot creative assets across email, display, social, search and video.  Effective, professional written and oral communication skills.  The ability to think “out of the box” in defining and solving problems.  Campaign performance (and other) data analysis, and the ability to develop business intelligence and actionable recommendations from that analysis.  The ability to effectively interact (often in a leadership role) with clients and colleagues across the executive, mid-manager and day-to-day operations levels in a professional, service-oriented manner.  Polished presentation skills, including the ability to clearly articulate the value of Ticketmaster’s marketing assets and services.  The dexterity to successfully manage, in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, multiple ongoing assignments, unplanned assignments and interruptions, and internal and external requests; and to prioritize and carry out those assignments effectively such that you exceed reasonable internal and external expectations. Our job descriptions evolve with our business need and priorities. In addition to the description above, your role may include additional projects and team support as needed. What a qualified candidate should possess:  BA/BS in Marketing or a related field.  Minimum of three years of experience developing multi-channel marketing campaigns.  Minimum two years of account management experience.  Experience in the live entertainment or music industry.  Proven ability to evaluate reports and data, identify trends and make effective tactical recommendations based on business intelligence.  Strong competence in Microsoft Office products.  Knowledge of popular CRM systems and web analytics tools (e.g., Salesforce, Google Analytics) is a plus.  Ability to use Adobe Photoshop and a basic understanding of HTML are also a plus.  Up to 20% travel required.E']

['What is CodeHS?CodeHS is a comprehensive program for helping schools teach computer science. We provide web-based curriculum, teacher tools and resources, and professional development.MissionThe mission of CodeHS is to empower all students to meaningfully impact the future.We believe that in the 21st century, coding is a foundational skill, just like reading and writing. That’s why we say: Read, Write, Code. We do this by providing great curriculum, tools, and resources to teachers, students, and schools to implement high quality computer science programs. We believe that everyone should get the chance to learn coding, and that it’s a skill that provides limitless creative opportunity to students. We want to help make computer science education fun and accessible, and believe you need both great tools as well as a great community to make this happen. We do this through our support for teachers, students and schools, with the help our dedicated team and amazing tutors.Marketing Manager Job DescriptionCodeHS is looking for an Marketing Manager to help grow CodeHS and spread computer science education to more students and more schools. Your primary responsibility will be managing marketing efforts at CodeHS.Responsibilities Manage marketing materials and customer resources Develop email newsletters and run email campaigns Help manage social media channels Help manage industry conferences Create case studies Work on branding and messaging Manage the blog and product and content marketing Make CodeHS more visible to potential schools and teachers Requirements Experience working in marketing Work well independently and autonomously, a self-starter Experience with email marketing Works well in teams Professional and clear at email Extremely organized and detail oriented Passionate about helping students and schools Excited to work at a small company and make a big impact 1-2+ years of professional marketing experience Edtech experience a bonus Experience with design (adobe photoshop/illustrator) preferred Experience with HTML/CSS a plus No experience coding is required, you should have an interest in learning Company ValuesEncourage Teaching and LearningCodeHS is about providing excellent teaching and learning opportunities in computer science for students all over the world. We value creating fun, accessible and creative learning experiences for teachers, for students, and for team members at CodeHS. We believe that education--and specifically coding--within the formal K-12 system, the higher-education system, and beyond has the power to allow everyone to unlock their full potential.Create a Direct Positive ImpactAt CodeHS we value creating a direct positive social impact with our work. We work directly with students, teachers, schools and districts to implement computer science classes. Through building great curriculum, tools and resources to allow high schools to teach computer science, we can create a direct educational benefit to students to help explore the limitless world of computing. We believe that expanding access to computer science education will empower students to take an active role in creating the future.Make It Fun and CreativeBringing fun and creativity to every aspect of our work is a main focus for us at CodeHS. It starts with a fun, friendly and accessible curriculum, that allows students the opportunity to build creatively and engage in thoughtful problem solving. We also focus on developing a creative and fun environment to work in, and think that this allows us to bring novel approaches to challenging problems. Computing is about logic--but it’s also about creativity--and we hope to share that excitement with teachers and students through CodeHS.']

["The Marketing Manager will plan, direct and coordinate the marketing activities for MC Machinery throughout North and South America. Managing a team the Manager will implement a marketing strategy and see its execution and analysis of results. This person must be flexible and adaptable to trends and industry changes and work to anticipate industry fluctuations and changes in a rapidly fluctuating industry. The Manager will coordinator trade shows and investigate any other events or activities that will represent the company and offer proper exposure. The incumbent will work closely with sales and service on creating marketing plans and strategies to increase sales and work to increase customer market share.Essentialresponsibilities Establishes marketing goals to ensure share of market and profitability of products and/or services. Develops and executes marketing plans and programs, both short and long range, to ensure the profit growth and expansion of company products and/or services. Researches, analyzes, and monitors financial, technological, and demographic factors so that market opportunities may be capitalized on and the effects of competitive activity may be minimized. Plans and oversees the organization's advertising and promotion activities including print, electronic, and direct mail outlets. Responsible for Trade Show budgets and planning. Communicates with outside advertising agencies on ongoing campaigns. Works with writers and artists and oversees copywriting, design, layout, and production of promotional materials. Develops and recommends pricing strategy for the organization which will result in the greatest share of the market over the long run. Ensures effective control of marketing results and that corrective action takes place to be certain that the achievement of marketing objectives are within designated budgets. Evaluates market reactions to advertising programs, merchandising policy, and product packaging and formulation to ensure the timely adjustment of marketing strategy and plans to meet changing market and competitive conditions. Conducts marketing surveys on current and new product concepts. Prepares marketing activity reports. Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. In-Depth knowledge of machining and manufacturing industry. Strong Microsoft Excel, Word skills. Graphic design knowledge a plus. Knowledge of social media usage and best practices. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to present and communicate to all levels of an organization. Education And Experience 5 years’ experience minimum in marketing. Minimum 3 years management experience. Experience in the machinery industry strongly preferred. Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising or related field. Equal Opportunity Employer – race, sex, veteran or disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation"]

We help build, connect, protect, and power valuable assets and critical infrastructures. From enterprise networks to industrial MRO supply to video surveillance applications to electric power distribution, we offer full-line solutions, and intelligence, that create reliable, resilient systems that sustain businesses and communities.Work EnvironmentOur founders developed the Blue Book more than 40 years ago to present the beliefs and ethos that define our business style. ["Fors Marsh Group LLC (FMG) is an applied research and strategy application firm headquartered in Arlington, VA, with satellite offices in Chicago, Illinois. FMG understands that diversity inspires innovation and attracts valued talent. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.We are currently seeking an experienced, skilled and organized Marketing Account Coordinator to provide assistance for our communication support contract with the United States Army account. ["What does Packback do?Packback exists to awaken and fuel the fearless, relentless curiosity in every student.We are a social learning platform powered by a proprietary A.I. that college professors use to help their students fall in love with the subject matter, drive personalized learning, and most importantly, quantify and improve critical thinking skills.What it's like to work on the Marketing team?As a 3 person team that services a 50 person revenue org we use agile project management to deliver impactful campaigns and results every two weeks. We strive to foster a collaborative, growth-oriented culture and accept nothing but exceptional performance as a result. As a small team, each individual is expected to contribute to building a world-class marketing function through continuous improvement and to take ownership of the team's performance and success.How will you add value to the team?You will be a key member of the marketing team who is responsible for planning, coordinating, executing and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. You'll help Packback reach new customers through email campaigns, guide leads through the sales process with personalized nurturing, automation, SEO and SEM. You'll build out marketing campaigns using segmentation, creative assets and copy to share the value of Packback with our leads and customers. This role requires a high level of creativity, attention to detail, excellent written communication skills and the ability to handle multiple concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment. Awesome stuff you will do!Plan and execute one-off and drip email engagement programs throughout all phases of the buyer journey to generate conversions (cold prospect, warm lead, hot lead, customer, etc)Strategize and execute digital campaigns across SEO/SEM, website, email and marketing automationCollaborate with marketing teammates to develop the content, copy and segmentation for email campaigns, as well as integrated, cross-channel campaignsManage multiple campaigns simultaneously and make adjustments as needed to optimize results by performing A/B testing with regularity.Measure, monitor and report on campaign performance, deriving insights from data and suggesting improvements to both strategy and tacticsUtilize strong analytical ability to evaluate end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touchpoints.Contribute to other growth marketing initiatives that generate leads such as conferences and customer activation programsObserve a company growing quickly and grow quickly as an individualWhat You Won't DoFeel like a number - we empower each other and celebrate the small and the big wins, every day. Every single team member makes a direct impact here.Get bored - we thrive off of curiosity and have fun while we do itWhat You Bring To The Table2+ years of professional marketing or related experience.Strong understanding of email marketing and buyer journeyA data-driven and conversion-oriented mindsetAgile and adaptable to changing circumstances or requirements.Highly accountable with ability to handle multiple projects, manage competing priorities and workflowProficiency in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and a basic understanding of Marketing AutomationExperience with SEO/SEM, HTML or Adobe Creative Suite a plusBe a lifelong learner - be willing to provide and receive feedback from team members on a regular basis, in a shared effort of furthering our personal and team growthValues fit - the individual must be aligned with all of our company values, but especially as it relates to:We are fearlessly curious.We are radically kind.We do what we say we will do.We never stop moving forward (no matter how small the step)We earn leadership through humility, optimism, and ownership.We employ an investor's mindset.What You Will EnjoyConvenient Loop office (Jackson & Michigan) close to CTA lines, Metra and paid parking lots6 weeks fully paid, gender non-specific extended leave policy (for either parent welcoming a new child through birth or adoption, or to care for a family member in need)Health insurance through BCBS of IL (we cover $250 a month per individual employee!), option for dental, vision and lifeShort-term disability insuranceFlexible vacation policy with a minimum of 10 days recommendedCompetitive salaries and room for professional growth. The base salary for this role is $50k with room to grow!Values-driven culture that encourages transparency and open communicationAnnual paid company offsite retreats and outings.Access to creative and educational events hosted at the Packback officeCasual dress codeOur office pup, Pepper!Note: She is a registered emotional support dog and has become part of our team. With that, we want to respect any and all pet allergies. If you do have dog allergies please let us know right away and we will be sure to put a solution in place.Our Commitment To DiversityWorking in the Education Technology space, Packback believes it is an ethical necessity for us to work to build a diverse and inclusive team, to help us better consider the needs of our diverse audience of students with a wide range of educational backgrounds and educational needs.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.5A8VNUjNe8"]

["OverviewAs a paid part-time employee for The Orchard, you'll be an influential advocate for artists that The Orchard distributes through implementing creative digital and in-person marketing strategies. Our College Marketing Reps are tastemakers in their market who have a strong online presence and work with local businesses, record stores, DJs, promoters, campus organizations, etc. to execute creative campaigns. College Reps focus on new releases and tour support for our thriving up and coming artists as well as established artists, covering a wide range of genres. An opportunity to express your creativity in your digital marketing campaigns, concert/album reviews, as well as while brainstorming promotional ideas for various artists. Access to inside information that will improve your marketing outreach Free ticket(s) into our artists' shows & possible meet and greet passes Build valuable relationships within your local music industry + many more!Qualifications Must be currently enrolled as an Undergraduate college student in a 4 year university with 2 or more years before graduation in Nashville. Must be able to manage your own hours and be accountable for the work assigned to you Availability of 15 hours a week A love of music and an understanding of how your peers discover and consume music A deep interest in the music business & marketing An active presence on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram - YouTube a plus Involvement in a campus organization is a plus Well-written and well-spoken Friendly, polite, persuasive and determined Transportation A digital camera Flexible scheduling for conference calls and tour coverageThe Orchard is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of age, disability, national origin, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law."]

['Outside Sales Representative Overview: EarQ a dynamic and innovative digital marketing and business consulting firm specializing in the hearing healthcare industry, is looking for ambitious and motivated individuals looking for a new challenge to join our team of Business Advisors. As a Business Advisor you will be responsible for finding and cultivating business relationships in order to grow your their territory and provide top-notch digital marketing and business consulting services to our network of hearing healthcare providers. You will be the face of EarQ to our members and their trusted resource for their business growth strategy! \xa0 Sales Representative Responsibilities: · Prospect and cold call potential hearing healthcare practices to learn about their current business needs and long term goals as well as promote EarQ’s digital marketing and business consulting programs as solutions to those needs. · Develop and cultivate long term advisory relationships with new and current practices to grow their business through EarQ’s digital marketing and business consulting programs. · Consult with hearing healthcare practices in pre-planned appointments to analyze their business and marketing practices in order to determine and advise on practice growth strategies and marketing needs. · Create, plan, and execute practice growth strategies through a business plan utilizing EarQ’s digital marketing and business consulting programs. · Continuously reassess the practice’s business plan and its performance and make recommendations and changes as needed. · Work in conjunction with territory’s Account Manager to communicate on the status of accounts, assess sales performance and strategize on driving sales results that meet or exceed KPI’s. · Attend trade shows, onsite client trainings and other events throughout the year. \xa0 Outside Sales Representative Benefits: · We offer a competitive base salary + commissions and benefits \xa0 Outside Sales Representative Requirements: · Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Business, marketing, or related field · Minimum of 4 years of previous sales experience, preferably consultative and/or in digital marketing · Ability to travel minimum 50% within territory including Illinois, Indiana, Michigan, Wisconsin, Missouri, Iowa, and Minnesota, North Dakota, South Dakota, and Nebraska · Excellent verbal and written communication skills']

Experience: ['SmarkLabs is looking for a Project Manager to organize, track, and align the work being done across clients. \xa0This includes work such as  design, web development, video production, paid media, copywriting, and more. We manage this work using a variety of software such as wrike, Google Drive, and Slack, and are always looking for candidates with flexible approaches to getting work done, and experience in key Marketing & Project Management sub-fields such as web strategy, user experience, branding, or Scrum/ Agile.First, you must work as a trusted resource between account management, clients, creative, and sales.\xa0Strategic Responsibilities\xa0The Creative Project Manager will -\xa0Define project scopes, and ensure that the work remains visible, documented, measurable, and trackable - with clear prioritization for all the work ahead.Provide reporting and planning to account managers and creative around the utilization, productivity, throughput.Fully understand the goals and objectives of the specific project work in order to serve as an authority and proxy when working with the Creative team and supporting contractors.Ensure that any creative direction or scope insights provided by sales and account managers are indeed reasonable, actionable, and beneficial to the larger goals of the companyOperational Responsibilities\xa0The Creative Project Manager will -Manage the day-to-day workload and responsibilities of the creative team and contractors\xa0Ensure those team members are not blocked, overburdened, or distracted in their work.Discover and document any requirements, dependencies, or other specifics of the project work that may emerge as the team execute their work.Maintain constant communication channels with the team members to ensure that they are aligned with the larger roadmap for each client, and they are maximizing their time for collaboration.All of this work will be done using our project management systems and processes identified as the best practices maintained and laid out by leadership. These best practices are anchored in the software, systems, and templates.What Does Success Look Like?A successful person in this role would form a high-level of trust with their team and client stakeholders. They would remain organized, unflustered, and candid about the work that is expected of them and their teams, and understand why the work matters.So if you are - or think you can become - an organized, collaborative thinker with strong documentation and core project management skills, we’d love to hear from you.Salary and benefitsCompensation based on experience and skillsetPerformance bonuses\xa0Work-from-home opportunities\xa0Medical/Dental/Vision benefitsPTOTeam-building events\xa0Casual work environment\xa0Our office is located 2 blocks from Union Station in the West Loop']

["At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. We're all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Works on initiatives supporting product launches, content optimization, and testing of different creatives. Partners with technology, marketing business partners, and design agencies to define and develop ongoing requirements for presentation templates, style sheets, and content. Requires consistent collaboration with multiple stakeholders within the company to foster synergies across departments and extend the content management standards across the enterprise.ResponsibilitiesProvides subject matter expertise to internal and external business partners on execution requirements and processes to assist in campaign planning. Measures progress of projects within the workflows and problem-solve with business partners to meet milestones and strategically support ongoing digital projects, maximizing speed to market.Gathers, documents, and communicates business requirements for digital messaging campaign execution in the email, push, and text channels with attention to detail and accuracy. (In some instances, may require html coding of assets). Iterative work on workflows and data capture templates, increasing their impact and efficiency over time, using content-management platforms (TeamSite).Problem-solves and assists in executing process/functionality enhancements to drive faster speed to market, operational efficiency, and cost reduction. Identifies, researches, and defines new initiatives driven by feedback from customers and business partners.Assists inOperational Risk event troubleshooting and reporting as required by Compliance.Creates and publishes content, leveraging web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.) to update digital content that delivers customer experience benefits. Performs and documents validation of creative assets, business requirements, and functionality on digital messaging campaigns before, during, and post campaign launch to ensure flawless execution and adherence to controls and processMinimum QualificationsAt a minimum, here's what we need from you:Bachelor's Degree in Marketing Finance, Business, or related field2+ years of experience in Marketing, Digital Marketing, or related fieldIn lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Marketing, Digital Marketing, or related fieldStrong understanding of HTML and CookiesStrong MS Excel skillsExperience with an enterprise-class web-content management systemPreferred QualificationsIf we had our say, we'd also look for:2+ years of experience in Financial Services, Client Service, Digital User Experience, or related field2+ years of working with a Messaging Communication platform: Email Service Provider or and CRM a plusAbility to multitask and be flexible with changing prioritiesAbility to work collaboratively and within a matrix environmentMust have excellent project management skillsExceptional organizational and communication skills.Familiarity with Agile and Waterfall methodologiesDiscover Financial Services is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, among other things, or as a qualified individual with a disability."]

["Job DescriptionTo be the World's Most Loved Children's Brand, we need the best people to join our team! Radio Flyer holds a special place in people's hearts. This is true because Radio Flyer transports people to a happy time, to the best parts of childhood, a time when anything was possible. For over 100 years, our company has produced innovative toys that inspire active play, bring smiles and create warm memories that last a lifetime. Beyond our classic Little Red Wagon, Radio Flyer invents and designs some of the most recognizable tricycles, ride-ons, scooters and battery operated vehicles in the industry.Radio Flyer has consistently been recognized as a top workplace and received numerous awards such as, Fortune’s Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Entrepreneur and CultureIQ’s Top Company Culture, Wall Street Journal’s Top Small Workplaces, the Daily Herald’s Best Places to Work in Illinois, and Crain’s Best Places to Work. Radio Flyer is a recognized leader in the toy industry, headquartered in Chicago and lead by Robert Pasin, grandson of the company founder.We are committed to a culture that embraces feedback, collaboration and innovation to achieve great results and drive business growth. At Radio Flyer we live by the Little Red Rule, “Every time we touch people's lives, they will feel great about Radio Flyer!”OpportunityThe Director of Marketing position will play a key role in the continued growth and success of the company. Working with Marketing team and cross-functional teams, this position will be responsible for the following.Specific Responsibilities Include Develop marketing plans to drive business growth by increasing brand awareness and purchase of new and existing products in all markets around the world.  Lead Communications team to deliver content to support new product launches, radioflyer.com initiatives, packaging artwork, internal communications, social media, and PR outreach.  Partner with Sales to create channel marketing plans, support sales initiatives, implement competitive strategy and drive sales.  Partner with Product Development to identify white space opportunities, create product roadmaps, brief new projects, position products at key customers, manage retail channels and target pricing.  Conduct market research to understand customers, competitors to identify market insights that lead to new business growth (new products, distribution plans, selling channels, brand awareness).Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communication or Business Management  Minimum 8 years experience in Product Marketing and Brand Management  Minimum of 4 years experience leading and developing a team of direct reports  Hands-on, innovative, results oriented leader  Strong decision maker with ability to prioritize complex objectives and meet aggressive timelines  Strong interpersonal skills including the ability to work with a cross-functional teamAbove All, The Individual Must Commit To Our Values F UN-omenal Customer Experiences L ive with Integrity Y es I Can E xcellence in Everything R esponsible for SuccessAt Radio Flyer, we appreciate different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives —encouraging everyone to bring their authentic selves to work. We are committed to employing a diverse workforce and are a proud equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. Please apply online at  Channel Marketing People Management/LeadershipJob Location Chicago, Illinois, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular"]

["E3 Diagnostics is a US-based sales and service company representing over 20 different audiology product manufacturers. E3 is wholly owned by a Danish hearing healthcare company – Demant. E3 is made up of 33 sales and service offices across the country and supported by the corporate team in Arlington Heights, Illinois. E3 sells to any entity providing hearing healthcare including Audiologists, ENT offices, schools, industrial customers and more. E3 is the market leader in this field.ResponsibilitiesDesigns, develops and implements marketing strategies and tactics to support the organization's products and services.Utilizes the company’s sales database to develop highly targeted marketing initiatives.Communicates and coordinates with the marketing teams from the various product manufacturers we represent to create synergies and avoid conflicting marketing messages.As a member of the e3 Leadership Team, work with others on this team and the field as necessary so that there’s clear understanding of the purpose and results of marketing programs and to gain support as needed.Responsible for gathering and maintaining an up-to-date, deep knowledge of our customers and the market place – the various segments, their needs, their roles, their scale and growth, the competition and potential changes, risks and opportunities.Coordinates the development of marketing communications materials (design and copy) to effectively represent the company, products, services, and brands to customers.Applies communication strategies to create a desired impression, raise awareness and encourage customer preference for the company and its products & services.Directs the hiring, training, and performance of the marketing staff of 3.Uses appropriate financial/analysis tools to justify the prioritization of new programs and related spending. Works closely with Sales to understand the potential implication of new tactics.Plans, develops and manages marketing events such as trade shows, conventions and sales meetings.QualificationsUndergraduate degree in business or marketing. MBA preferred.7 years of hands-on Marketing experience – preferably in a medical diagnostic business. Experience with distribution and/or service businesses are a plus.Desirable but not mandatory to have managerial experience.Emphasis on marketing strategy, communications (less emphasis on product development and pricing).Very current with latest, practical B2B social media tools.Bright, creative, organized, self-starting team-player willing to work in “small company” atmosphere. Strong communicator.E3 Diagnostics is part of the Demant Group. Demant is a world-leading hearing healthcare group that for more than a century has played a vital part in developing innovative technologies and know-how to help improve people’s hearing and health. In every aspect, from hearing devices, hearing implants and diagnostic equipment to intelligent audio solutions and hearing care all over the world, Demant is active and engaged.The Demant Group operates in a global market with companies in more than 30 countries, employs more than 14,500 staff and generates annual revenue of DKK 14 billion (approx. 2.1 billion USD). Our products are sold in more than 130 countries.We are an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.e3"]
